text: it's seems much difficult... Cause every blog post has different tags... So i have to match tags for every loop instance :sweat_smile:

What’s the solution for blog API to allow cross-origion ??, I am trying to fetch blog list into one HubSpot page and their i need to use API cause we have more that 100 blog and HubSpot blog function has 100 post limitation

Hello team, Sorry in advance if my question is silly, I'm a beginner at HubSpot.

I'm creating contact through contacts API whenever someone completes DOI in my website, This is working as expected but in HS I'm not able to track his activity. I read blogs and found that HS tracks users based on cookie value and that cookie installed by tracking code. I can get that cookie from client's browser but how can I set that cookie into contact through API so I can able to track his activity seamlessly.  Any idea ?

Hey, people! How's it going? I'm new here and I'd like to share a question (my first one :hamsterdance:):
Can I track and collect data from events directly? I've been doing this using a third-party framework on my website (it tracks sesssion, duration, interactions and many other stuff) but I'd like to know if I can do this whilst using HubSpot only. I've read some info on HubSpot's marketing and events API, which can get me some data with the Web Analytics route, but it's still in beta phase and there aren't many variables in this route as there are in the framework I've been using already.
Kind regards :heart:

Check this out, it will explain a bit more, but HS uses the cookie to track visitors across your site, but the Contacts API doesn't allow passing that info. You would need to use the Forms API (this explains a bit better): <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Contacts-API-and-HubSpotutk/m-p/271822#ajaxfeedback_0>
We have an issue with the contact API- it no longer seems to return the name property?
I can't remember if it was default returned or not, but you can specify any additional properties you want returned by adding &property=x&property=y to your URL
Thanks, tried this though and no luck
Even with the v3 API, which returns these by default they come back null
The customer sent a screenshot of the HS UI and it indeed has a name
Ok, so the screenshot was showing the deal name as the customer name. They are mistaken
APIs which require `hapikey` deliberately do not allow cross-origin. Which specific API are you using?
Yeah you have to pass that data back via Forms. They should really fix Contacts to allow this data.

There is some mixture of topics happening here.

Are you talking about submitting events from the site, or analyzing events collected from the site, or both?

I am not following you 100% quite yet.

I have never seen a "name" for contact only for company and deal. Contact must be split into first name and last name. However I think HubSpot should change this eventually because it doesn't work well in some non European languages.
